content: in a proof, I set the notation let g : ι → R := λ (k : ι), (ite (k = i) 1 0) and later on, I have an expression including g x in my goal. I tried rw g, but I think I understand why this is not helpful. How do I replace g x with (ite (x = i) 1 0) in my goal?
To give concrete advice, having a #mwe is helpful. You can probably do simp only [g] to do the replacement.

That does the trick, thanks! I thought there would be something more specific than simp only, but I am content.

Re: #mwe, I agree that if this answer was not enough, then I would owe you one :)
